metadata.title: YouTube SEO Checklist 2025: Optimize Every Video
metadata.description: Complete YouTube SEO checklist for 2025. Step-by-step optimization for titles, descriptions, tags, thumbnails, and more.

hero.headline: The Ultimate YouTube SEO Checklist for 2025
hero.subheadline: Never miss an optimization step. Use this checklist to maximize every video's potential.

sections.content: Consistent optimization separates growing channels from stagnant ones. This checklist covers every SEO element you should address before, during, and after uploading. Bookmark it and use it for every video to ensure nothing falls through the cracks.

sections.title: Before Recording
content: Research keywords with decent search volume
Check competition for your target keyword
Review top-ranking videos for content gaps
Plan your hook for the first 30 seconds
Script or outline your video with SEO in mind
Prepare your thumbnail shot in advance

sections.title: Before Upload
content: Rename video file with target keyword
Create 3-5 thumbnail variations
Write title with keyword in first 60 characters
Draft description with keyword in first line
Prepare 5-8 relevant tags
Create timestamp chapters if applicable

sections.title: During Upload
content: Select the right category for your content
Add video to relevant playlists
Set appropriate language and caption options
Add end screen with subscribe button
Add cards linking to related content
Double-check thumbnail is clear at small size

sections.title: After Publishing
content: Pin a comment with call-to-action
Share to relevant social platforms
Respond to early comments to boost engagement
Check analytics after 48 hours
Consider thumbnail swap if CTR is below average
Update description if you missed anything

sections.title: Quick Wins You Might Miss
content: Add hashtags in description (3 max for best results)
Include your keyword in spoken audio for transcription
Use all 500 characters allowed for description
Link to your other videos in description
Add location tags if relevant to your content

faq.question: Do I need to do all of this for every video?
faq.answer: The core elements (title, description, tags, thumbnail) are essential for every video. Additional steps like cards and end screens can be added in batches later if needed.

faq.question: How long should I spend on SEO per video?
faq.answer: Most optimization should take 15-30 minutes per video once you have a system. Keyword research might add 15 minutes for new topics. It's time well spent.

faq.question: What's the most important SEO element?
faq.answer: Title and thumbnail together drive CTR, which is crucial for discovery. After that, watch time (content quality) matters most. Tags and description are supporting factors.

faq.question: Should I update old videos with better SEO?
faq.answer: Yes, especially for videos that get search traffic. Updating titles, descriptions, and thumbnails can revive underperforming content. Prioritize videos with potential.
